summary: James N. Roethe was a Commission staff member involved in taking depositions related to potential CIA involvement in assassination plots. He is mentioned in connection with the deposition of Frank Sturgis and Wilfredo Navarro on April 4, 1975, where they discussed potential CIA involvement in assassination plots. Roethe also authored a memorandum summarizing information obtained from George Brewer regarding the CIA's Washington Field Office activities. His involvement appears to be focused on gathering information and testimony related to CIA activities and potential assassination plots during the time of the investigation.
significance: James N. Roethe's significance lies in his role as a Commission staff member actively involved in gathering information and taking depositions related to potential CIA involvement in assassination plots, contributing to the investigation of the JFK assassination context.
